abstract: Independent conservative groups, able to operate free of many legal restrictions, have gathered into a loosely organized political machine poised to rival, and in many ways supplant, the official Republican Party apparatus in 2012 elections; groups recruit top strategists and donors from the traditional party structure, and operate much like official party committees, but they have the freedom to accept and spend unlimited money.
snippet: Able to operate free of many legal restrictions, independent groups have become a loosely organized political machine poised to rival, and largely supplant, the Republican Party.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)

lead_paragraph: Able to operate free of many legal restrictions, independent groups have become a loosely organized political machine poised to rival, and largely supplant, the Republican Party.

headline.main: Outside Groups Eclipsing G.O.P. as Hub of Campaigns
headline.print_headline: Outside Groups Eclipsing G.O.P. As Hub of Campaigns Next Year
